text: What is the specific employment-related purpose of this AI system? Select all that apply.

options.label: Recruitment screening
options.description: Filtering, ranking, or scoring job applicants

options.label: Resume parsing/analysis
options.description: Extracting or analyzing information from resumes

options.label: Interview analysis
options.description: Analyzing video, audio, or text from interviews

options.label: Workforce monitoring
options.description: Monitoring employee activity, keystrokes, or communications

options.label: Termination decisions
options.description: Identifying employees for layoffs or termination

options.label: Scheduling
options.description: Automated employee scheduling or shift assignment

regulatoryRelevance: Employment AI is classified as high-risk under EU AI Act Annex III. NYC LL144 specifically targets automated employment decision tools. Illinois BIPA governs biometric use in employment.

text: Are candidates or employees notified that AI is used in the decision-making process?
regulatoryRelevance: NYC LL144 requires notice to candidates at least 10 days before use. Colorado AI Act requires disclosure. Illinois AI Video Interview Act requires consent. EU AI Act requires transparency.

text: Is there an alternative non-AI process available for candidates or employees who prefer not to be evaluated by AI?
regulatoryRelevance: Illinois AI Video Interview Act requires an alternative process. Colorado AI Act requires accommodation. GDPR Article 22 grants the right not to be subject to solely automated decisions.

text: Has a disparate impact analysis been conducted to evaluate whether the system produces different outcomes across protected groups?
regulatoryRelevance: NYC LL144 requires annual bias audits published publicly. Title VII of the Civil Rights Act prohibits disparate impact. Colorado AI Act requires impact assessments addressing algorithmic discrimination.

text: What employee or candidate data does the system process? Select all that apply.

options.label: Interview recordings
options.description: Video or audio recordings of interviews

options.label: Communications
options.description: Emails, messages, or other work communications

options.label: Biometric attendance
options.description: Fingerprint, facial recognition, or other biometric attendance tracking

options.label: Social media
options.description: Publicly available social media profiles or activity

options.label: Background checks
options.description: Criminal history, credit checks, reference verification

regulatoryRelevance: Illinois BIPA strictly regulates biometric data in employment. Interview recordings may trigger wiretapping laws. Background check data is regulated under FCRA at the federal level.
